page.title: 17RELIGION
page.content:
50 1church 64 1railway station 67 3bus services
The children of this school also found that Roby Church contains a unique series of oak panels brought from the Netherlands by one of the Earls of Derby.The Church records acknowledge the receipt of these panels and state that they were intended for a boat house, but, because of their religious significance, the Earl gave them to Roby Church.The church has a spire with a peal of bells used for the announcement of Sunday services.Around the church is a graveyard with some graves dating back over 100 years.Entrance to the graveyard is via a lych gate.
